title: Llewellyn Thomas
summary: Llewellyn Hilleth Thomas (21 October 1903 â€“ 20 April 1992) was a British physicist and applied mathematician.[1] He is best known for his contributions to atomic and molecular physics and solid-state physics. His key achievements include calculating relativistic effects on the spin-orbit interaction in a hydrogen atom (Thomas precession), creating an approximate theory of N {\displaystyle N} -body quantum systems (Thomas-Fermi theory), and devising an efficient method for solving tridiagonal system of linear equations (Thomas algorithm).
